resources.string:
Our Organization is dedicated to continued providing support to our veteran community. According to the data obtained from the Department of Defense, 1 in 3 veterans who has served in a war zone reports some form of physical or other health issue. The number goes higher when it comes to how many of these veterans have this health issue get in the way of them finding a job. Many veterans are pushed into homelessness. However, the county can help if it can identify such persons and intervene to help them start their new chapter in the civilian life. This app will provide the county with user\-generated data on homeless persons in San Diego. The county officials can then identify such persons, reach out to them, intervene and help them out. Currently, it is hard to obtain data on homeless veterans because of a lack of permanent address and the information is not available as easily from the federal agencies. By signing into the app, you can help. All you have to do is, if you spot a homeless person on the streets of San Diego, just report it using the map tool. Your level of participation in this app will determine how much information about the homeless person you will be asked to provide. Information includes visible details such as, is the person carrying any sign or board that identifies them as veterans or what they are requesting (food, money etc). This information is crucial in understanding the problems of homeless in San Diego. The tool is especially designed for veterans but also captures data on other homeless persons.
If you register as a veteran, there are some more resources from the city for you.

There are many ways you can join us: 1) Volunteer by reporting homeless citings. Your level of information determines how much information you\'ll be asked to provide about the report. Your information will help the County of San Diego identify homeless veterans in need of financial or any other assistance. Currently, it is not easy to get this information and your reports will help! 2) Contribute: You can also contribute directly by donating an amount to the County of San Diego by addressing this amount to : . Currently, it takes over 319 days on an average for a veteran in San Diego to get their claims processed with the Veteran Affairs. It takes even longer at the Los Angeles office according to the data obtained from the Department of Veteran Affairs. If a veteran needs immediate financial assistance to address their health or mental issues, we can reach out to such veterans through the County of San Diego that will identify veterans in need and we can help them.
